InternalServerError.description: Please retry again later or contact support if the issue persists

UnauthorizedError.description: Please make sure the Authorization Header is set and uses correct credentials

ValidationError.description: Some fields of the request have failed the validation procedure.

ipAcl.description:
List of IPs that can mount the Resource Pool in read-only; IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP)

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the resource pool
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

sizeGigabytes.description:
Size of the Resource Pool

 (unit: gibibytes)

snapshotsAreVisible.description:
Whether the .snapshot directory is visible when mounting the resource pool.
 Setting this value to false might prevent you from accessing the snapshots (e.g.
 for security reasons). Additionally, the access to the snapshots is always controlled
 by the export policy of the resource pool. That means, if snapshots are visible and
 the export policy allows for reading the resource pool, then it also allows reading
 the snapshot of all shares.

comment.description: (optional) A comment to add more information about a snapshot

name.description: Name of the Resource Pool Snapshot

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share export policy
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

name.description: Name of the Share Export Policy

rules.description:
List of rules of the Share Export Policy. The order of the rules within the array does not matter - what matters
 is the field "order" within each rule

ipAcl.description:
IP access control list, where IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP)

 This array cannot be empty

order.description:
Order of the rule within a Share Export Policy. The order is used so that when a client IP matches
 multiple rules, the first rule is applied

 This field must be set

readOnly.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule can only mount the share in read only mode

 Default: false

setUuid.description:
Flag to honor set UUID

 Default: false

superUser.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule have root access on the Share

 Default: true

exportPolicyName.description:
Name of the Share Export Policy to use in the Share.

 Note that if this is not set, the Share can only be mounted in read only by clients with IPs matching the
 IP ACL of the Resource Pool hosting this Share. You can also assign a Share Export Policy after creating
 the Share

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

spaceHardLimitGigabytes.description:
Space hard limit for the Share. If zero, the Share will have access to the full space of the Resource Pool it lives in.

 (unit: gibibytes)

error_description.description: Human-readable string of the error that occured

title.description: Human-readable description of the error that occurred.

type.description: URI Uniquely identifies the error type. It will be in the format of storage.stackit.cloud/<error-type> e.g. storage.stackit.cloud/validation-error

GoogleProtobufAny.description: Contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a @type that describes the type of the serialized message.

@type.description: The type of the serialized message.

availabilityZone.description: Name of the respective availability zone

countShares.description: Number of Shares in the Resource Pool

ipAcl.description:
List of IPs that can mount the Resource Pool in read-only; IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP)

mountPath.description:
Mount path of the Resource Pool, used to mount the Resource Pool

 Note that a Resource Pool can only be mounted in read-only

performanceClassDowngradableAt.description: Time when the performance class can be downgraded again.

sizeReducibleAt.description: Time when the size can be reduced again.

snapshotsAreVisible.description:
Whether the .snapshot directory is visible when mounting the resource pool.
 Setting this value to false might prevent you from accessing the snapshots (e.g.
 for security reasons). Additionally, the access to the snapshots is always controlled
 by the export policy of the resource pool. That means, if snapshots are visible and
 the export policy allows for reading the resource pool, then it also allows reading
 the snapshot of all shares.

state.description:
State of the Resource Pool

 (possible values: ["pending", "creating", "created", "updating", "error", "deleting"])

comment.description: (optional) A comment to add more information about a snapshot

logicalSizeGigabytes.description: Represents the user-visible data size at the time of the snapshot in Gibibytes (e.g. whatâ€™s in the snapshot)

resourcePoolId.description: ID of the Resource Pool of the Snapshot

sizeGigabytes.description:
Reflects the actual storage footprint in the backend at snapshot time in Gibibytes (e.g. how much storage from the Resource Pool
 does it use).

snapshotName.description: Name of the Resource Pool Snapshot

peakIops.description: Max. IOPS of the Resource Pool. This is shared between every Share in the Resource Pool.

availableGigabytes.description:
Available space of the Resource Pool

 (only available when retrieving a single Resource Pool by ID)

sizeGigabytes.description: Size of the Resource Pool in Gibibytes.

usedGigabytes.description:
Used space of the Resource Pool

 (only available when retrieving a single Resource Pool by ID)

exportPolicy.description:
Details of the Share Export Policy to use in the Share.

 Note that if this is not set, the Share can only be mounted in read only by clients with IPs matching the
 IP ACL of the Resource Pool hosting this Share

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

mountPath.description: Mount path of the Share, used to mount the Share

spaceHardLimitGigabytes.description:
Space hard limit for the Share. If zero, the Share will have access to the full space of the Resource Pool it lives in.

 (unit: gibibytes)

state.description:
State of the Resource Pool Snapshot

 (possible values: ["pending", "creating", "created", "error", "deleting"])

id.description: ID of the Share Export Policy

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share export policy
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

name.description: Name of the Share Export Policy

rules.description:
List of rules of the Share Export Policy. The order of the rules within the array does not matter - what matters
 is the field "order" within each rule

sharesUsingExportPolicy.description: Number of Shares using this Share Export Policy

id.description: ID of the Share Export Policy Rule

ipAcl.description:
IP access control list, where IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.251/32" for a specific IP)

 This array cannot be empty

order.description:
Order of the rule within a Share Export Policy. The order is used so that when a client IP matches
 multiple rules, the first rule is applied

 This field must be set

readOnly.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule can only mount the share in read only mode

 Default: false

setUuid.description:
Flag to honor set UUID

 Default: false

superUser.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule have root access on the Share

 Default: true

Status.description: The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details. You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

details.description: A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

message.description: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the [google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

ipAcl.description:
(optional) List of IPs that can mount the Resource Pool in read-only; IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP)

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the resource pool
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

sizeGigabytes.description:
(optional) Size of the Resource Pool

 (unit: gigabytes)

snapshotsAreVisible.description:
Whether the .snapshot directory is visible when mounting the resource pool.
 Setting this value to false might prevent you from accessing the snapshots (e.g.
 for security reasons). Additionally, the access to the snapshots is always controlled
 by the export policy of the resource pool. That means, if snapshots are visible and
 the export policy allows for reading the resource pool, then it also allows reading
 the snapshot of all shares.

ipAcl.description:
IP access control list, where IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs,
 or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP)

 This array cannot be empty

order.description:
Order of the rule within a Share Export Policy. The order is used so that when a client IP matches
 multiple rules, the first rule is applied

 This field must be set

readOnly.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule can only mount the share in read only mode

 Default: false

setUuid.description:
Flag to honor set UUID

 Default: false

superUser.description:
Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule have root access on the Share

 Default: true

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share export policy
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

rules.description:
List of rules of the Share Export Policy. The order of the rules within the array does not matter - what matters
 is the field "order" within each rule. The whole set of rules needs to be sent in the same request, e.g. if 1 rule
 is sent, the share export policy will have just that 1 rule, as opposed to extending the existing set of rules with
 the 1 rule that was sent

 Important note: the array of rules passed always overwrites the rule array (i.e. sending an empty array removes all rules)

exportPolicyName.description:
Name of the Share Export Policy to use in the Share.

 The behavior depends on the value:
 - If not set (null): Keep the existing export policy (if any)
 - If set to empty string (""):  Remove the existing export policy
 - If set to a policy name: Update to use the specified policy, creating a new association if none exists

labels.description:
An optional object that represents the labels associated with the share
 keys are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}][\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$' and cannot be empty
 values are validated using the following regex '^[\\p{Ll}\\p{N}_-]*$'

spaceHardLimitGigabytes.description:
Space hard limit for the Share. If zero, the Share will have access to the full space of the Resource Pool it lives in.

 (unit: gibibytes)

field.description: The name of the field in the request that has failed the validation

reason.description: The reason why the validation failed
